name: puppetize.net
tagline: Collaborative infrastructure development, self-learning and teaching.
body:
### Project Goals
The @puppetize organization on GitHub was founded in 2012 by me (@ustuehler) as an experiment in improving the development and adoption of shared modules and best practices for [Puppet](http://puppetlabs.com/puppet/what-is-puppet/).

Our work here may overlap with [example42](http://example42.com) and other community projects, but rather than compete, we wish to learn from them and to collaborate as much as we can.

Beyond that, our ambitious aim is to build a cool self-teaching environment for beginners and advanced users alike, with basic online tutorials that can be executed in a browser, and with sandboxes hosted in an OpenStack private cloud for advanced learning.  Think of [tryruby.org](http://tryruby.org), only for Puppet. :)

We also want to encourage the discussion of a wide range of meta-topics, including best practices regarding the setup of Puppet infrastructures, design principles for cross-platform modules, abstractions of basic infrastructure elements (like backup and monitoring solutions) and workflows for large teams.
